caption: b'Hemoglobin is a key oxygen-carrying protein found in our blood. Genetic problems in hemoglobin production lead to diseases such as sickle cell disease and beta thalassemia. At Vertex, we\xe2\x80\x99re dedicated to understanding those genetic problems as we search for potential treatments for these hemoglobinopathies. Visit the link in our profile to learn more in the new Vertex Forward animated video.'

b'Battling their inherited diseases from birth, people living with beta thalassemia and sickle cell disease experience a myriad of symptoms, frequent hospital visits and many are still waiting for a treatment to address the underlying cause of their disease. Visit the link in our profile to learn about these serious diseases and our commitment to patients as we build a toolkit of technologies and talent to further our research in these diseases.'

b'Whether it\xe2\x80\x99s a Day of Service project or a #virtual volunteer event, #VertexVolunteers prioritize coming together to make a difference. \n \nTomorrow, on #GivingTuesday, we\xe2\x80\x99re thankful for our community for working together to #giveback during this unprecedented time. Join us in recognizing #GivingTuesday and visit @givingtuesday to learn more about how you can get involved. #InThisTogether #togetherwegive'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99re big fans of wearing purple, especially when it\xe2\x80\x99s to raise awareness for alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency (AATD). Throughout #AATDAwarenessMonth in November, Vertex employees joined the community to walk 25 miles to raise awareness.\n\nA special thank you to the @alpha1foundation for organizing this #virtual walk and for helping us come together to make a difference. #a1fvw20 #inittogether'

b'For those living with type 1 diabetes, the disease requires constant daily management, from monitoring blood sugar, food and exercise, to continual insulin treatment. Even with excellent care, type 1 diabetes can cause many long-term complications, including kidney failure, eye problems and nerve problems. Learn about diabetes and our approach in this new video, Vertex Forward: Diving Into Type 1 Diabetes. Visit the link in our profile to watch it in full.'

b'#DYK: Type 1 diabetes is a chronic, metabolic disorder caused by a deficiency of insulin secretion by the pancreas. This #NationalDiabetesMonth, here from our VP of clinical development for our type 1 diabetes program, to learn what fascinates him most about his #research in this disease area.'

b'Relentless. Passionate. Driven. This #NationalDiabetesMonth we asked Leela, a member of our type 1 diabetes program, to share what she loves most about her work. Watch below to hear what motivates her most. #greatplacetowork'

b'With so many different permutations, CF impacts everyone differently. Scientific advancements have brought answers for many, but there\xe2\x80\x99s still work to be done. Click the link in our profile to learn more about advances in CF research.'

b'Here at Vertex, #teamwork drives our #innovation engine. This #WorldDiabtesDay, meet one of the members of our type 1 diabetes program as he shares what he loves most about being part of this team.'

b'Living with diabetes can be a challenge for patients, families and caregivers, but nurses make the difference. On #WorldDiabetesDay, we thank nurses working in the field of diabetes for their competence, care and compassion. #wdd2020'

b'In people with alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency (AATD), a defective AAT protein is produced in the liver but can\xe2\x80\x99t travel to the lungs to help protect them from damage. Learn how this affects the body and causes serious symptoms in this animated video, Vertex Forward: Taking on AATD.'

b'Did you know? Alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency, or AATD, is a genetic disease that can cause severe liver disease, emphysema and other lung damage. This #AATDAwarenessMonth, learn about this disease and the impact it has on the patient community in the newest video of our Vertex Forward animated series: Taking on AATD. Visit the link in our profile to watch it in full.'

b"On this #VeteransDay, we honor and remember all those who have served, and continue to serve, our country.\n\nWe're proud to support the brave, talented military veterans throughout Vertex, through programs such as our employee-led resource network, BRAVE, created to support the veteran and first responder community. Watch above to learn more."

b'As we recognize #Alpha1Awareness Month, we\xe2\x80\x99re excited to introduce you to some of the team members working on our Alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency program. Watch above to meet Taylor, a director of clinical trial management, as she shares what she loves most about being on this team.'

b'Calling all #students! Applications for the Vertex Foundation Scholarship are now open. This scholarship supports people living with #cysticfibrosis (#CF) and their immediate family members to pursue two-year, four-year or graduate degrees. Visit the link in our profile to apply today.'

b'Our body is made up of tens of thousands of genes that tell our cells and every part of our body how to function. We know that certain differences in our genes can put some people at higher risk of disease. The better we understand those differences, the more likely we\xe2\x80\x99ll be able to find potential treatments. At Vertex, we hope to do just that with APOL1-mediated kidney diseases. Learn more in this new animated video. Visit the link in our profile to watch it in full.'

b'Our team at Vertex is dedicated to making a difference in the lives of those with inherited kidney diseases like focal segmental glomerulosclerosis (FSGS). In this video, learn how we\xe2\x80\x99re moving Vertex forward by increasing understanding and research for APOL1-mediated kidney diseases. Visit the link in our profile to watch it in full.'

b'62 organizations. Over 1,100 employees. In 14 countries. Watch this quick recap to hear from some of the #vertexvolunteers and members of our partner organizations who made this year\xe2\x80\x99s annual #DayofService events the most successful yet.'

b'Today is International Day for Disaster Risk Reduction. Providing immediate relief and assistance after a natural disaster is crucial and the Vertex Foundation supports on-the-ground organizations such as @directrelief, @americares and @americanredcross to directly support on-the-ground efforts in the wake of a disaster. Visit the link in our profile to hear from Executive Director of Corporate Responsibility Katharine Jensen to learn more. #drrday'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99re thrilled to congratulate Adan, one of our Vertex Science Leader Scholarship winners, as he begins pursuing his passion for #STEAM as a biology major at @umassd this fall. We\xe2\x80\x99re beyond excited for this next step in his educational #career.'

b'Vanessa, one of our Vertex Science Leader Scholarship winners, was inspired to pursue a career in computer science after working with @girlswhocode, an organization that works to increase the number of women working in technology fields. Join us in congratulating Vanessa as she continues her educational #career in #STEAM at @umass this fall.'

b'Despite the distance for many of our #givingback initiatives, #VertexVolunteers came out in full force to help the community for this year\xe2\x80\x99s annual #DayofService. See below for a few of the many pictures we captured during this incredible week. A huge thank you to our partner organizations and the 1200+ #VertexVolunteers who came together to make this week possible!'
b'The sickle cell community inspires us all. Watch above to meet some of our team members as we shine a light on sickle cell disease this #sicklecellawarenessmonth. #InItTogether'

b'Innovation has been the force behind scientific discoveries, even before labs existed. This #painawarenessmonth Maya, one of our scientists on our #pain research team in San Diego, shares a fact that surprised her about the history of pain treatments.'

b'Now more than ever, we\xe2\x80\x99re committed to giving back to the communities in which we live and work. This year, our annual Day of Service has turned into a full week of primarily #virtual volunteer opportunities around the world.\n\nFollow the hashtag #VertexVolunteers to see what our team is up to throughout the week!'

b'Stacy\xe2\x80\x99s life has been defined by numbers. But her refusal to let them hold her back inspires us to keep going, too. Visit the link in our profile to learn more about Stacy\xe2\x80\x99s cystic fibrosis journey and her optimism towards the future.'

b'It is hard to believe that fall is already here. Join us in congratulating our two Vertex Science Leaders Scholarship recipients, Adan and Vanessa, as they begin pursuing their passions in #STEAM at @umass and @umassd! \n \nAs part of our #virtual high school #summer internship, we saw first-hand how both Adan and Vanessa were able to succeed and overcome any challenges that came their way. We are so proud of everything they\xe2\x80\x99ve accomplished and look forward to supporting them throughout their careers.'
b'Sabine, Head of Medicinal Chemistry in San Diego and a member of our #pain research team, speaks out about #pain this #painawarenessmonth and her passion for working on complex programs.'

b'Eric Cassalina is a 28-year-old financial advisor, husband, and new father who is living with CF. Many people like Eric are grateful for the scientific advancements that have come, but there is still more work to be done to reach those living with CF who don\xe2\x80\x99t yet have a treatment option. Visit the link in our profile to learn more.'

b'Serial innovation is a team sport. This #sicklecellawarenessmonth, Katie, a member of our hemoglobinopathies clinical team, shares what she loves most about the collaborative environment here at Vertex as we work together in the fight against #sicklecelldisease.'
b'Meet Peter, a member of our #pain research team in the UK, as he shares what motivates him to come to work each and every day. #painawarenessmonth'

b'Alex, one of our scientists in San Diego, shares what he loves most about being part of the pain research team here at Vertex. Follow the hashtag #painawareness to help us recognize this debilitating disorder that affects more than a billion people around the world.'

b'Meet Catalina, a member of our hemoglobinopathies team as she shares what makes her so passionate about the work she is doing each and every day. Join us in recognizing #sicklecellawarenessmonth this September.'

b'Here at Vertex, we\xe2\x80\x99re always learning from our challenges and our successes in order to refine our unique approach to scientific #innovation. Visit the link in our profile to watch as we illustrate the research strategy at the center of everything we do \xe2\x80\x94 from discovering medicines to our goal for the future of our pipeline.'

b'At just 33, Stacy has lived longer than believed possible. After undergoing more than a dozen surgeries and spending 80 weeks on IV antibiotics, she is still hopeful for a scientific breakthrough that will help her form of #cysticfibrosis. Visit https://nyti.ms/2GAgeif to learn more about Stacy.'

b'Margarete knows the variability of cystic fibrosis all too well. Although it took her daughter, she still has hope for her adult son, Eric. Her strength in the face of loss inspires us in our pursuit for answers. Visit https://nyti.ms/2GAgeif to learn more about their stories.'

b'Did you know: The European World Duchenne Organization chose today, September 7th (9/7) to recognize World Duchenne Awareness Day because the #DMD gene has 79 exons? Hear from two of our scientists and follow the hashtag #wdad20 to join us in raising awareness today and throughout the month. #strongerthanduchenne'

b'Every day Stacy wakes up is another day she has defied the odds. Although she is one of the people with a rarer genetic mutation that causes cystic fibrosis, she remains hopeful for future scientific advancements. Visit https://nyti.ms/2GAgeif to see how differently CF can affect those living with it.'

b'Cystic fibrosis, which can be highly variable, struck Eric and his little sister, Jena, very differently. Visit https://nyti.ms/2GAgeif to learn more about the Cassalina family\xe2\x80\x99s story and advances in CF research.'

b'Looking for a great summer recipe? You\xe2\x80\x99ve got to try Mexican Fish Sopes made by Boston-based chef @kenoringer!\n \nCheck out the link in our bio to listen to his episode as part of our partnership with @cooktracks, a podcast hosted and produced by @onkappysplate and @rachaelray. This season\xe2\x80\x99s series brings together the culinary world and #cysticfibrosis awareness to help us all stay connected through #food.'
b"In support of the #stophateforprofit movement, we're pausing all ads on Facebook and @instagram."

b'"Pride isn\xe2\x80\x99t going anywhere, because Pride is everywhere." \xe2\x80\x93 @trevorproject . Visit the link in our bio to learn how our growing PRIDE employee resource network is focusing on #community, #leadership and #advocacy to continue to foster an environment where everyone feels comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work. #showyourpride #prideeverywhere'
b'New medicines wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t be possible without the dedication of patients, caregivers and their families. Thank you for all that you do.'

b'So awesome to cook along with @kenoringer and @onkappysplate today! Chef Oringer\xe2\x80\x99s Fish Sopes are the perfect summer dish. Check out our podcast partnership at @cooktracks and stay tuned for Chef Oringer\xe2\x80\x99s recipe which will be added soon. #cooktracks'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99re beyond excited to join @bottom_line_org for a #virtual event to celebrate two of our Vertex Science Leaders scholars, Sayed and Glady, tomorrow along with more than 700 first-generation college graduates for their hard work and perseverance to get to this milestone! Watch above to learn more about our Vertex Science Leaders Scholars and visit @bottom_line_org to help us congratulate this year\xe2\x80\x99s graduating class.'

b'The #cysticfibrosis community is at the center of everything we do. Meet JJ Jackson from our patient services team as he shares our commitment to the #CF community today and every day. #cfawarenessmonth #goingthedistanceincf'

b'What says "comfort food" better than mama's meatballs? In this @cooktracks episode, chef Rocco DiSpirito\xc2\xa0will help you make his mother's famous recipe! Click the link in our bio to follow @RoccoDiSpirito along. You can also listen to the entire @cooktracks season, which is dedicated to creating delicious meals with the needs of a #CF diet in mind. \xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
Thanks to @rachaelray, @onkappysplate, and all of the talented chefs who brought us new culinary inspiration when we needed it most. When we\xe2\x80\x99re able to venture out again, we look forward to dining out in our local communities - and if we are lucky \xe2\x80\x93 one of your restaurants! #supportrestaurants'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cAt Vertex, our efforts to discover transformative medicines to help people with serious diseases never stops \xe2\x80\x93 not even during a pandemic. We wanted to make sure you knew we were still here. Still here, fighting for you every day.\xe2\x80\x9d Hear from members of our team about our relentless commitment to our patient communities. #CFAwarenessMonth #inittogether'

b'Our dedication to the cystic fibrosis community extends beyond our own R&D efforts. Visit our instagram story to learn about Circle of Care, an annual grant opportunity that funds innovative patient-centric programs for the 
CF community.

#CFAwarenessMonth #GoingtheDistanceinCF'

b'If you\xe2\x80\x99ve heard of shakshuka, but have never tried making it, now is the time. It\xe2\x80\x99s a warmly spiced vegetarian dish, perfect for breakfast, lunch or dinner. For this episode of the @CookTracks podcast series, chef Zach Engel puts his spin on shakshuka by adding sweet potatoes. \xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3\n\xe2\x81\xa3 \xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3\nClick the link in our bio to listen to the podcast with @ZJEngel and explore the entire series. While crafted specifically with the needs of a #cysticfibrosis diet in mind, these recipes can be enjoyed by everyone!'

b'Learn how we are inspiring the next generation of #scientists to go the distance in #cysticfibrosis research through our Innovation Awards. Visit the link in our profile to learn more. #CFAwarenessMonth #GoingtheDistanceinCF'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99re excited to begin sharing the powerful stories of this year\xe2\x80\x99s Vertex Foundation Scholarship recipients, created to support the #cysticfibrosis community pursue college and/or graduate degrees. Visit our Instagram story to learn more. #CFAwarenessMonth #goingthedistanceincf'

b'In this episode of @CookTracks, chef @zjengel will walk you through how to make a perfect fried fish dish with dipping sauces. If you don\xe2\x80\x99t have all the ingredients at home, listen in and bookmark this recipe to create at another time.\xe2\x81\xa3\n\xe2\x81\xa3\nTo learn more about our partnership with @CookTracks and this podcast series, which was designed with the #cysticfibrosis community in mind, click the link in our bio to learn more and hear what else we\xe2\x80\x99ve been cooking!'

b'Hats off to this year\xe2\x80\x99s recipients of the Vertex Foundation Scholarship, created to help people living with #cysticfibrosis and their immediate family members pursue two-year, four-year or graduate degrees! Visit the link in our profile to learn more and to meet some of this year\xe2\x80\x99s recipients. #CFAwarenessMonth #GoingtheDistanceinCF'

b'#Vertex employees are proudly displaying their commitment to #goingthedistanceinCF over zoom! \xe2\x81\xa3\n\xe2\x81\xa3\nVisit our Facebook page at https://bit.ly/2XaTiuP to download one of our zoom backgrounds to join our work family in raising awareness throughout the month. #CFAwarenessMonth'

b'Nutrition is an important part of maintaining overall health while living with #cysticfibrosis. Our new podcast partnership with @cooktracks is helping us bring delicious meals into your kitchen that meet the needs of a #CF diet.\xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
\xe2\x81\xa3
This episode features chef Sarah Grueneberg\xe2\x80\x99s orecchiette with Italian sausage and peppers. It\xe2\x80\x99s perfect for any night of the week and you can easily substitute ingredients with whatever you have at home. Follow along with @chefsarahjayne as she makes this tasty pasta dish by clicking the link in our bio.'

b'Thank you to our partners at @frontlinefoodsbos and local #boston restaurants for helping us provide 10,000 meals to hospital staff on the front lines at  @brighamandwomens and @massgeneral. Scroll through to see some of the photos from this week\xe2\x80\x99s deliveries.'

b"Searching for some culinary creativity? We've teamed up with @CookTracks to create an audio series that takes listeners step-by-step through the making of a meal. While crafted with the needs of the #cysticfibrosis diet in mind, these recipes can be enjoyed by everyone!\xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3 \xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3\n\xe2\x81\xa3\nIn this episode, chef Sarah Grueneberg takes braised chicken thighs up a notch by adding honey-balsamic with cauliflower and dried figs. Click the link in our bio to listen and cook along with @ChefSarahJayne!"

b'Together with @frontlinefoodsbos, the Vertex Foundation has made a donation to ensure that hospital staff on the front lines at @brighamandwomens and @massgeneral receive a total of 10,000 nutritious meals this week.\xe2\x81\xa3 \xe2\x81\xa3\xe2\x81\xa3\n\xe2\x81\xa3\nThe purchase of the meals from local #Boston restaurants such as @flourbakeryandcafe, Eastern Standard, @_branchline, and Orinoco will also help support restaurant employees who have been affected by COVID-19 economic impacts. Visit our Instagram Story to learn more. #InThisTogether #everydayheroes'

b'Thank you to all the teachers, parents and caregivers who are working hard to bring classrooms to our homes during these challenging times, especially our partners at @bostonschools and @sandiegounified. We have so much respect for what you do. #thankateacher #teacherappreciationweek'

b'@CookTracks is a podcast produced by Andrew (Kappy) Kaplan and television personality @rachaelray. The podcast, hosted by Kappy, invites well-known chefs and food personalities to take listeners step-by-step through cooking a meal in real time. This season of @CookTracks focuses on meals created with the #cysticfibrosis community in mind. \xe2\x81\xa3\n\xe2\x81\xa3\nClick the link in our bio to listen to our first episode with Rachael herself. She\xe2\x80\x99ll talk you through how to make her Tex-Mex Mighty Migas, an egg dish that can be enjoyed any time of the day. If you don\xe2\x80\x99t have all of the ingredients, you can use one of your favorite grocery delivery services or listen and create the recipe at a later time to enjoy with friends and family.'

b'Cooking can bring us together. Learn more about our new partnership with @cooktracks, a podcast by @onkappysplate and @rachaelray that brings tasty meals into your kitchen. This season focuses on dishes created with the #cysticfibrosis community in mind, but are recipes the whole family can enjoy. \nCF mom, Ginger Birnbaum, @gbpeartree, helps kick-off the podcast series with host Andrew (Kappy) Kaplan to spread some knowledge and inspiration about CF. Click the link in our bio to learn more about Ginger, the powerhouse chefs featured this season, and their recipes.'

b'This #GivingTuesdayNow we recognize our employees and those around the globe who are #givingback in response to the unprecedented need caused by #COVID19. Visit https://bit.ly/3fjnT1z to learn some of the ways the Vertex Foundation, #VertexVolunteers and nonprofit partners are #InThisTogether during this challenging time.'

b'We are excited to launch a new partnership with @cooktracks, a podcast hosted and produced by @onkappysplate and @rachaelray. This season\xe2\x80\x99s series brings together the culinary world and #cysticfibrosis awareness to help us all stay connected through #food.\xe2\x81\xa3\n\xe2\x81\xa3\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re spending more time in our kitchens, so listen and follow along as the talented chefs of this series talk you through making their delicious meals. The recipes were created with the needs of a #CF diet in mind, but they can be enjoyed by everyone! Click the link in our bio to learn more.'

b'At Vertex, we\xe2\x80\x99re dedicated to going the distance for the cystic fibrosis community. By #GoingtheDistanceinCF, we won\xe2\x80\x99t give up, no matter how challenging the \xe2\x80\x9clast mile\xe2\x80\x9d may become. We will continue to relentlessly pursue research with the goal of discovering treatments for everyone living with this disease \xe2\x80\x93 a shared mission of not only every Vertex employee, but across the #CF community of nurses, doctors, caregivers and people living with CF.'

b'Tonight we\xe2\x80\x99re going #red to show our support for the kids, teams and entire @goteamimpact community who work hard each day to match children with #cysticfibrosis to college sports teams across the country. \nVisit @goteamimpact\xe2\x80\x99s profile at 7 PM EST tonight to join us in tuning into a video in honor of their annual Team IMPACT Gala. #GameDayGala #betheimpact'

b"On the 50th anniversary of #EarthDay, we\xe2\x80\x99re sharing our commitment to #sustainability. Visit the link in our profile to read some of the actions we've taken to support the environment and the new target we\xe2\x80\x99ve set for the future in our action against #climatechange."

b'We love to hear stories like Carson and his brother and are such proud partners of @goteamimpact. Read more about how to get involved with @goteamimpact via the link in our profile. #repost \xe3\x83\xbb\xe3\x83\xbb\xe3\x83\xbb\nCarson and his brother got crafty during quarantine, when they made a sweet LEGO replica of the @muspartansoccer stadium, including some pretty cool spectators and players! Carson has been matched with the Manchester Men\xe2\x80\x99s Soccer team for just over 6 months, but it\xe2\x80\x99s clear to see that this match is already going to leave an impact that\xe2\x80\x99ll last a lifetime. Thanks to our partner @vertexpharmaceuticals for making matches like this possible!'

b'When we stand together, we\xe2\x80\x99re stronger together. Our #Boston office is going blue alongside @johnhancockusa and @teambaa to show our gratitude for all of the #essentialworkers on the front lines risking their lives each day to fight #COVID19. Visit the link in our profile for some creative ways to join us in saying a collective thank you from your :house_with_garden:. #BostonStrong #Everydayheroes'
b'Hear Dr. Reshma Kewalramani, President and #CEO, talk about the future of #Vertex. #Greatplacetowork'

b'We are grateful for the #hardworking #healthcare professionals working around the clock to keep us and our loved ones safe during this time. Today and every day all of us here at Vertex are thankful for the important work you do each day. #NationalDoctorsDay'
b'Step inside the walls of Vertex to meet some of our scientists and learn about our drug discovery process.'

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s World Kidney Day, an annual awareness day started in 2006 to raise public understanding of the frequency and impact of kidney diseases worldwide. Follow the hashtag #WKD2020 to help raise awareness and visit our Instagram story for educational facts.'

b'Today, Sunday, March 8, is #InternationalWomensDay! Here at Vertex we proudly support women year-round through programs such as IWILL, our employee resource network focused on inspiring women to be leaders in the workplace and beyond.'

b'In celebration of #WomensHistoryMonth, Azin Nezami, Director of Innovation and External Research here at Vertex, joined other leaders for a discussion at @logmein to share stories and explore the power of women\xe2\x80\x99s voices to help us all rise together.'

b'Last week, the Vertex Foundation and @i2learning partnered with the @sandiegounified to bring STEM Week to @knox_middle for a week of fun, hands-on #STEM activities. Visit the link in our profile to learn more about our commitment to supporting students throughout their educational journeys and beyond. #lovestemsd'

b'Today, on the rarest day of the year, we are honored to recognize #RareDiseaseDay, an annual awareness day to elevate public understanding of rare diseases and call attention to the challenges people face. #leapyear #showyourstripes'

b'We are proud to be part of the fight against #rarediseases.This week, Vertex employees showed off their zebra striped ribbons in recognition of rare diseases such as #cysticfibrosis, #sicklecelldisease, #betathalassemia, #DMD, Alpha-1 Antitrypsin Deficiency (AATD) and APOL1-Mediated Kidney Disease. Visit the link in our profile to learn more. #showyoursripes #rarediseaseweek'

b'#DYK: An estimated 7000 rare diseases have been identified around the globe. To raise awareness, our #Boston office will light up a different color each night this week to represent a #raredisease such as #cysticfibrosis, #sicklecelldisease, #betathalassemia, #DMD, #Alpha1 and #APOL1. #showyourstripes'

b'#DYK: As many as 300 million people are living with a rare disease around the world :globe_showing_Americas:. Follow the hashtag #RareDisease to help us raise awareness for the people, families and #caregivers living with a #raredisease this #rarediseaseweek. #showyourstripes'

b'This #nationalcaregiversday, we\xe2\x80\x99re sharing a collection of stories from our #cysticfibrosis community to recognize the dedicated, compassionate and loving #caregivers such as Adam and Jordan shown above who continually go above and beyond for their loved ones each day. Tap the link in our #bio for the full edition.'

b'Hear what it\xe2\x80\x99s like to #intern here at @vertexpharmaceuticals from Zoe, one of our past interns in the Office of Business Integrity and Ethics. Head to the link in our profile to learn more about our early career opportunities!'

b'#VertexVolunteers in action at the @rmhcsandiego helping with demo day for the upcoming Vertex Foundation Family Welcome Center! Visit the link in our profile to learn more about our new partnership with the @rmhc.'

b'At the center of caring is love, a force that drives us to go above and beyond for others. This #valentinesday, we\xe2\x80\x99re sharing a special collection of stories written by the #cysticfibrosis community to recognize the thoughtful and dedicated #caregivers such as Colby and Erin featured above, who continue to make so much possible for their loved ones. Visit the link in our profile to learn more.'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cVertex creates a culture where you are learning every day. I am very excited to come to work, not only because of what I do, but because of the people.\xe2\x80\x9d- Segun Oyedele,a former @hack.diversity #intern turned full-time employee, shares what he likes most about coming to work each day.'

b'As part of our Love is in the Care program, we\xe2\x80\x99re sharing the stories of #caregivers who continually go above and beyond to make so much possible for their loved ones. Visit the link in our profile to read their story and help us recognize this special part of the #cysticfibrosis community.'
b'Harold Bernstein, our VP of Translational Medicine, tells us what makes @vertexpharmaceuticals employees stand out from the pack - their fearless drive.'

b'Today and every day, we\xe2\x80\x99re grateful for the #caregivers who go above and beyond for their loved ones each and every day. As part of our Love is in the Care program, we\xe2\x80\x99re honored to help Liana recognize her husband, John, a loving caregiver to their two children living with #cysticfibrosis.'

b'#BlackHistoryMonth is a time to celebrate #blackculture and recognize #AfricanAmericanHistory. Vertex employees got together in our #Boston office to celebrate this rich history with traditional African drummers and dancers. We\xe2\x80\x99re thankful for our Employee Resource Network, Vertex Includes Boundless Ethnicities (VIBE), for putting together such great events.  Scroll through to see some of the photos!'

b'#TeamIMPACT parents reflect on their experience being part of the Syracuse Men\xe2\x80\x99s Lacrosse Team, \xe2\x80\x9cFrom day one, the team has brought Gaven and us in as part of their family. Gaven has come to have dozens of big brothers and it has driven him to do better each day in so many aspects of his life. It has also helped us become better, loving parents instead of just caregivers.\xe2\x80\x9d Stories like this are why we are such proud sponsors of @goteamimpact, a national nonprofit connecting courageous kids with #CF with college sport teams across the country. Visit @goteamimpact to learn more. #BeTheIMPACT #TogetherWeChampion'
